description: Number of partitions of n into distinct triangular numbers C(k,2).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: For n>0: a(n) = b(n, 1) where b(n, k) = if n>k*(k+1)/2 then b(n-k*(k+1)/2, k+1) + b(n, k+1) else (if n=k*(k+1)/2 then 1 else 0). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 26 2003
example: a(31) counts these partitions:  [28,3], [21,10], [21,6,3,1], [15,10,6] _Clark Kimberling_, Mar 09 2014
mathematica: Drop[ CoefficientList[ Series[ Product[(1 + x^(k*(k + 1)/2)), {k, 1, 15}], {x, 0, 102}], x], 1](* also *)t = Table[n (n + 1)/2, {n, 1, 200}] ; p[n_] := IntegerPartitions[n, All, t]; Table[p[n], {n, 0, 12}] (*shows unrestricted partitions*)d[n_] := Select[p[n], Max[Length /@ Split@#] == 1 &]; Table[d[n], {n, 1, 31}] (*shows strict partitions*)Table[Length[d[n]], {n, 1, 70}] (* _Clark Kimberling_, Mar 09 2014 *)
